heading: Regulation 4 of the Principal Regulations is amended -
text_raw:
6. 

Regulation 4 of the Principal Regulations is amended - 

(a) 

by the substitution of the following paragraph for paragraph (1): 

“(1) Subject to paragraph (5), a person shall not organise, or 
cause to be organised, an event to be held in a dwelling in a 
relevant geographical location other than in accordance with 
paragraph (2).”, and 

(b) by the insertion of the following paragraph after paragraph (4): 

“(5) Paragraph (1) shall not apply during 

the period 
beginning on the 18th day of December 2020 and ending on the 
6th day of January 2021.”.

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: Regulation 12 of the Principal Regulations is amended -
text_raw:
10. 

Regulation 12 of the Principal Regulations is amended - 

(a) 

in paragraph (1), by the substitution of “Subject to paragraph 
(3A), a specified person shall” for “A specified person shall”, 
and 

(b) by the insertion of the following paragraph after paragraph (3): 

“(3A) 

(a) 
Subject to subparagraph (b), a specified person 
may, for the purpose of holding one or more live 
performances at the following premises: 

(i) 

the 
Abbey 
Mainistreach); 

Theatre 

(Amharclann 

na 

 
 
 
 [653] 5 

(ii) 

the National Concert Hall; 

permit or otherwise grant access to members of the public to 
such premises. 

(b) 

(i) The number of persons attending at each live 

performance shall not exceed – 

(I) 

(II) 

in the case of a premises referred to in 
clause (i) of subparagraph (a), 2 persons, or 

in the case of a premises referred to in 
clause (ii) of subparagraph (a), 100 persons. 

(ii) For the purposes of clause (i), in reckoning the 
number of persons attending a live performance 
at a premises referred to in clause (i) or (ii) of 
subparagraph (a), no account shall be taken of 
persons so attending in a professional capacity, in 
the course of their employment, or in fulfilment 
of a contract for services.”.

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: The Principal Regulations are amended, in Schedule 2 -
text_raw:
11. 

The Principal Regulations are amended, in Schedule 2 - 

(a) 

by the substitution of the following paragraph for paragraph 1: 

“1. 
Theatres and concert halls (other than the Abbey Theatre 
(Amharclann na Mainistreach) and the National Concert Hall, in 
so far as those premises hold one or more live performances in 
accordance with Regulation 12 (3A)).”, 

(b) by the substitution of the following paragraph for paragraph 15: 

“15. Any business or service that is selling or supplying 
intoxicating liquor for consumption on the premises and that, 
but for Regulation 12, is otherwise permitted by law to do so - 

(a) 

other than where (and without prejudice to the 
generality of subparagraph (3)(b) of that Regulation) 
such intoxicating liquor is - 

ordered by or on behalf of the member of the 
public being permitted, or otherwise granted, 
access to the premises, at the same time as a 
substantial meal is so ordered, during the meal 
or after the meal has ended, and 

consumed by that member during the meal or 
after the meal has ended, 

(i) 

(ii) 

or 

(b) other than insofar as they sell food or beverages on a 
takeaway basis for consumption off the premises.”, 
and 

(c) 

by the deletion of paragraph 16. 

 
 
 6 [653] 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

17 December, 2020. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [653] 7

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A - Temporary 
Restrictions) (Covid-19) (No. 9) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 560 of 2020) to 
provide for the disapplication of certain restrictions over the Christmas Period 
(18 December 2020 to 6 January 2021). They also provide for certain sporting 
events and live performances to be held. The Regulations remain in operation 
until 31 January 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 8 [653]
